pros: 1. Believes in starting programs 2. Allows you the freedom to run things how you see fit 3. Hold you accountable for quotas
cons: 1. Small school with limited budgets

pros: I like my coworkers. They extremely nice.

pros: I taught what I am good at and enjoyed doing it.

salary is low.
low enrollment related job insecurity.
students are different from those at public institutions.

review_title: Some great colleagues, but terrible administration
pros: Colleagues are great, teaching can be very rewarding
cons: Administrators are suspicious of faculty, undermining important programs that give students the strong experience that used to be possible, and academics is declining in many areas as great faculty keep leaving and areas are shrinking. Pay is terrible compared to other private colleges -- minimal raises. School is moving toward more online model and is leaving liberal arts model behind. Faculty were mostly happy even just a few years ago, but almost all faculty are pretty unhappy now.

job_title: Assistant Clinic Director in Madison, WI
pros: Staff and Students are wonderful to work with
cons: Low wages and benefits for employees

job_title: Assistant Professor, Graphic Design in Madison, WI
pros: know students small classes strong bonds
cons: constant changes underpaid lots of committee time

job_title: Student IT Specialist in Madison, WI
pros: Teamwork based environment. You can learn a lot if you choose to. Pathway to full time employment after graduation.
cons: Pay starts out weak. Increases at 50 cent intervals per semester.

pros: Student-focused learning; value on community engagement
cons: Faculty not always included in decisions that impact us

pros: People, Location, Paid Holidays and Vacation Time
cons: Other than the low salary range, it's been great!

review_title: Dedicated faculty and staff, backward leadership
pros: The faculty and staff at the college work very hard to support students with selfless hard work. The student experience is wonderful in many programs. Student support services are excellent. Most people outside of higher-level leadership are mission-driven and clearly care about the college values. Many faculty and staff receive free college tuition for their kids.
cons: Poor leadership that does not provide basic resources for staff and faculty to do their work well, very low pay, very high turnover, constant broken promises, conflict-averse managers who do not tell the truth to upper level leaders. IT support is excellent for top leaders and very poor for everyone else. There is poor communication from leaders to faculty and staff, and an arrogant lack of interest in what we might learn from outside our institution. Strong resistance to innovation. People are given heavier and heavier workloads without changes in titles and compensation.

review_title: Passionate people, crippled by a lack of vision and incompetent upper management.
pros: Edgewood has a very strong community that is absolutely dedicated to student success. Work-life balance is good, the benefits are uniformly excellent, and the social atmosphere on the main campus is convivial and cooperative.
cons: The pay is very low, even among similar institutions, for non-academic positions. Parking is a perennial problem. And upper management is largely unqualified and myopic, meaning that the school has had difficulty identifying a niche in an increasingly competitive market.

review_title: Strong mission, values, weak potential for growth and creative programming
pros: Dedicated FT faculty, students are "good people" who are respectful and willing to work hard.
cons: Poor compensation planning, HR department is constantly changing, and employee resources are lacking.

review_title: A nice place with organizational issues
pros:
Great vacation time
Flexible work hours
Extra time off at Christmas
Strong sense of community and institutional values
"Good people"
Strong retirement plan (for now, may change in near future)
cons:
Lack of communication
Poorly managed support departments (facilities, IT, etc.)
No formal employee review system
Lack of accountability
Low salaries with almost non-existent raises
Few/no opportunities for career growth (professional development is focuses on faculty with little opportunities for staff)

review_title: Very good people with a singular world view furthering the cause of liberal arts education.
pros: A comfortable, pleasant organization with a dedicated approach to serving students. Faculty and staff are committed to the students above almost everything else.
cons: There is a lack of diversity in viewpoints, with the college faculty and staff leaning to the extreme left. Liberal arts is also a fading approach to education, with a need to include marketable skills in the curriculum.

pros: The people are very nice and it is a very good teaching experience.
cons: The pay is abominably low--2,000/credit hour for adjuncts.  The school relies way too highly on underpaid adjuncts who have little hope to be come tenure track.

pros: Community feeling,great benefits,very small town feel.
cons: hire a-lot of college part-time workers to cover professional positions,have begun to out-source certain depts.

pros: Flexible hours, great people, nice environment, small classes.
cons: Low pay, classrooms could be better, sometimes very warm.

job_title: Network and Systems Administrator in Madison, WI

cons: Little room for advancement. Sometimes conflicting priorities.

pros: People are easy to get along with, good benefits for part-time employees,
